title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for correctly describing one similarity.

Two points for correctly describing two similarities.
descriptions: The response does not correctly describe one of the following similarities between the agricultural practices shown in Image 1 and Image 2:
The response correctly describes one of the following similarities between the agricultural practices shown in Image 1 and Image 2:
The response correctly describes one of the following similarities between the agricultural practices shown in Image 1 and Image 2:

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that the potato was originally introduced to Europe as a food crop through relocation diffusion.

Two points for explaining how the potato was originally introduced to Europe as a food crop through relocation diffusion, with reference to the spatial pattern of this diffusion.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following processes by which the potato was originally introduced to Europe as a food crop:
The response correctly explains one of the following processes by which the potato was originally introduced to Europe as a food crop:
The response correctly explains one of the following processes by which the potato was originally introduced to Europe as a food crop:

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating an effect that the practice shown in Image 2 may have on local water resources.

Two points for explaining how the process of the practice shown in Image 2 may affect local water resources.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that the agricultural practice shown in Image 2 may affect local water resources:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the agricultural practice shown in Image 2 may affect local water resources:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that the agricultural practice shown in Image 2 may affect local water resources:

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that monocropping increases economies of scale because it maximizes profits and minimizes costs.

Two points for explaining how the process of monocropping increases economies of scale by maximizing profits and/or minimizing costs.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following degrees to which the practice of monocropping may increase the economies of scale for farmers:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which the practice of monocropping may increase the economies of scale for farmers:
The response correctly explains one of the following degrees to which the practice of monocropping may increase the economies of scale for farmers:

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or examples, and to score the response.

One point for stating that increasing demand for processed potato products in more developed countries benefits potato farmers in less developed countries.

Two points for explaining how the process of increasing demand for processed potato products in more developed countries benefits potato farmers in less developed countries, or a specific effect for farmers in less developed countries.
descriptions: The response does not correctly explain one of the following ways that increasing demand for processed potato products in developed countries may affect potato farmers in less developed countries:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that increasing demand for processed potato products in developed countries may affect potato farmers in less developed countries:
The response correctly explains one of the following ways that increasing demand for processed potato products in developed countries may affect potato farmers in less developed countries:
